chapter.title: Overview
chapter.para: OpenStack is a cloud operating system that controls large pools of compute, storage, and networking resources throughout a data center, all managed through a dashboard that gives administrators control while empowering their users to provision resources through a web interface.

&productname; provides easy to use installation and management workflows for OpenStack cloud. It allows an entire OpenStack cloud environment to be modelled before deployment, and it deploys and updates the OpenStack cloud environment to match the models even as the models are updated.

section.title: About this guide
section.para: The following guide is what is known as a Proof of Concept (POC) Guide. A POC focuses on whether a test case can be turned into production-grade implementation. The details within this guide are generic, and are only meant to determine the feasibility of the idea or test case.

section.title: Skill requirements
section.para: Before you begin working through this guide, it is important to understand your individual use case for your OpenStack deployment. We recommend reading this guide with the following questions in mind:

listitem.para: What problem am I trying to solve?
How does this solve my problem?
How do I want to implement my SUSE OpenStack Cloud?
